## CartesianLineBindings interface

Describes the bindings between the fields necessary to render a line in cartesian space and the input data source. Note that edge x1/y1 and x2/y2 are derived from the source and target node positions, and hence do not need a binding config. TODO: the source/target binding implies an edge, not a generic line.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface CartesianLineBindings 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [stroke?](./schema.cartesianlinebindings.stroke.md) |  | string | <i>(Optional)</i> Bindings for the color of the edge. |
|  [width?](./schema.cartesianlinebindings.width.md) |  | [NumericFieldScaleBinding](./schema.numericfieldscalebinding.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> Bindings for the width of the edge. |
